author: TimonTerWijlen96
post_text: February 12, 2019 at 9:51 PM#1Hi guys 'n gurls!When I update a group, how is it possible to update the fx by using a macro. For example: I store my spot and wash groups into a group I use for dim fx, how can I update that fx so it use the fixtures I stored in the fx group?Let me know!

posts.author: TimonTerWijlen96
posts.post_text: February 12, 2019 at 9:51 PM#1Hi guys 'n gurls!When I update a group, how is it possible to update the fx by using a macro. For example: I store my spot and wash groups into a group I use for dim fx, how can I update that fx so it use the fixtures I stored in the fx group?Let me know!

posts.author: scoobytoobins
posts.post_text: February 17, 2019 at 7:45 PM#2Call them by name.I’d use ‘wings_wash’ and ‘sin_wash’ and ‘swing_wash’ as effect names, then store the group of your new washes, select that group and then store effect *.’wash’

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: February 18, 2019 at 1:57 PM#3The right syntax is : store effect 1."*wash".*1 is effect pool*wash calls all effects with wash in label* are all lines

title: Change fixtures in effect by using macro
